definition: tastelessly showy, a lamp for providing momentary light to take a photograph, appear briefly
details:
adjective
- tastelessly showy
= example: tastelessly showy
= synonyms: loud
noun
- a lamp for providing momentary light to take a photograph
= synonyms: photoflash, flash lamp, flashgun, flashbulb, flash bulb
- a bright patch of color used for decoration or identification
= example: a bright patch of color used for decoration or identification
- a momentary brightness
- a sudden brilliant understanding
= example: a sudden brilliant understanding
- a short news announcement concerning some on-going news story
= synonyms: news bulletin, newsflash, newsbreak
- a burst of light used to communicate or illuminate
= synonyms: flare
- a gaudy outward display
= synonyms: ostentation, fanfare
- a short vivid experience
= example: a short vivid experience
= synonyms: flashing
- a sudden intense burst of radiant energy
- a very short time (as the time it takes the eye to blink or the heart to beat)
= example: a very short time (as the time it takes the eye to blink or the heart to beat)
= synonyms: wink
verb
- appear briefly
= example: appear briefly
= synonyms: gleam
- emit a brief burst of light
= example: emit a brief burst of light
- make known or cause to appear with great speed
= example: make known or cause to appear with great speed
- protect by covering with a thin sheet of metal
= example: protect by covering with a thin sheet of metal
- run or move very quickly or hastily
= synonyms: shoot
- expose or show briefly
= example: expose or show briefly
- display proudly
= synonyms: swank
- gleam or glow intermittently
= example: gleam or glow intermittently
= synonyms: blink
